info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 05 at 4:01AM PST until December 05 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County above 3000 feet. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest and most persistent snowfall will occur above 5,000 feet, including Mt Shasta Ski Park and highway 89 at Snowmans Summit. However, snow will occasionally impact I-5 and local roadways in Mt. Shasta City, especially this morning with snowfall rates approaching one inch per hour. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
